article.title: Simulated Microgravity Alters Gene Regulation Linked to Immunity and Cardiovascular Disease

funding.text: NASA Human Research Program Human Health Countermeasures (HRP HHC) NNJ14ZSA001N-FLAGSHIP
NASA Human Research Program Human Health Countermeasures (HRP HHC) NNJ13ZSA002N-FLAGSHIP

article.abstract: Microgravity exposure induces a cephalad fluid shift and an overall reduction in physical activity levels which can lead to cardiovascular deconditioning in the absence of countermeasures.

sections.introduction: Spaceflight leads to cardiovascular deconditioning in the absence of mitigation strategies.
sections.methods: Animal experiments were carried out in accordance with the recommendations of Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals, 8th edition.
sections.results: In this study, we made use of the rodent HU model to gain insight on the effects of microgravity exposure on molecular signatures of the heart.
sections.discussion: Our findings from a rat hindlimb unloading (HU) model for cephalad fluid shift and microgravity exposure suggest sex and age differences in oxidative stress responses.

article.insights_summary: Our findings suggest sex and age differences in oxidative stress responses to microgravity exposure.
article.acknowledgments: We are grateful to April Ronca and other members of Ames SC Division for coordinating this NASA-funded tissue-sharing opportunity.
